intro: Tithymalus tomentellus, commonly known as the woolly tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas or along forest edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
